snippet: A concept based on Buddhist teachings encourages people to eat slowly, paying close attention to the sensation and purpose of each morsel.
abstract: Mindful eating is a concept that has its roots in Buddhist teachings and encourages people to eat slowly, paying close attention to the sensation and purpose of each morsel; in the eyes of some experts, what seems like the simplest of acts, eating slowly and genuinely relishing each bite, could be the remedy for a fast-paced society in which an endless parade of new diets never seems to slow a stampede toward obesity.
lead_paragraph: A concept based on Buddhist teachings encourages people to eat slowly, paying close attention to the sensation and purpose of each morsel.

headline.seo: Mindful Eating as Way to Fight Bingeing
headline.main: Mindful Eating as Food for Thought
